answers.answer: Hello,It can be due to parasthesia skin. Causes are neuropathy(esp in diabetes),hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, nerve compression, multiple sclerosis, diabetes and vitamin B 12 deficiency. Get your vitamin B 12 levels and thyroid levels evaluated from a physician. Also take some vitamin B 12 supplements for some days.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: This is difficult to describe but here goes:  For the past month or so, when I take a shower, or wash dishes, the inside of my fingers (between the fingers) feels like there are grains of sand between them.  It feels like when someone has soaked their hands in water for a long time - and get wrinkly - but in my case, this sensation of sand between the fingers happens after 3-4 mins.  Not sure if this is a concern or not but i knew that it wouldn't hurt to ask the question.  Should I be concerned or is this just some sensitivity issue that comes with age..?  I'm 42.  Any input would be great.  Thanks so much :)
title: Tingling between fingers when in water
